lessons.japanese: 自分自身に疑問を持つことは良識の第一歩だ。
lessons.english: To have doubts about oneself is the first sign of intelligence.

lessons.japanese: 自分自身に疑問を持つことは良識の第一歩だ。
lessons.english: To have doubts about oneself is the first sign of intelligence.

lessons.japanese: 学者が必ずしも良識のある人とはいえない。
lessons.english: A man of learning is not always a man of sense.

lessons.japanese: なるほど彼は若いが、良識に富んでいる。
lessons.english: It is true he is young, but he has much good sense.

lessons.japanese: あなたの良識を疑います。
良識のある人ならそんな風に君に話しかけないだろう。
lessons.english: A man of sense wouldn't speak to you like that.

lessons.japanese: 良識のある人ならそんな風に君に話しかけないだろう。
lessons.english: A sensible person wouldn't speak to you like that.

lessons.japanese: 分別ある人というのは良識を働かす人である。
lessons.english: A sensible person is one who uses good sense.

lessons.japanese: 彼は良識があると思いますか。

lessons.english: He is a person with good sense.

lessons.japanese: 行儀の悪さは彼の良識を疑わせるものだ。
lessons.english: His bad behavior is a reflection on his common sense.

lessons.japanese: 学者が必ずしも良識のある人とはいえない。
lessons.english: A man of learning is not always a man of sense.

lessons.japanese: なるほど彼は若いが、良識に富んでいる。
lessons.english: It is true he is young, but he has much good sense.

lessons.japanese: あなたの良識を疑います。
行儀の悪さは彼の良識を疑わせるものだ。
lessons.english: His bad behavior is a reflection on his common sense.
